climbs.name: Wasian School Boys
climbs.fa: Jay Shultis, Alexandra Higgins, Mark Rineer

content.description: Leading this route is a bit heady out the gate but the gear gets better as you go.  Climb a 30' slabby buttress up it's left side to a 20' face above.  Exit into a narrow gully to the right of a small cherry tree growing out of the rock.  This will keep you out of the briars for the topout.  Belay and rappel from a huge tree on the right side of the gully.  Originally covered in rock tripe, Mark Rineer and I cleaned this in 2003 thinking it would probably need a couple bolts, it appears to be staying fairly clean and climbs cleanly on gear.  Crux mantle to get on the route and one tricky section of face climbing off the high ledge near the finish.
content.protection: Lots of interesting gear, but it is all small.  I would reccomend double of smaller sizes for a ground up on-sight.  I used a mix of small BD C4's & X4's (all 0.5 or smaller) as well as a couple decent ball nuts for the topout after the crux.  A 0.1 X4 or small C3's would work for the finish if you do not have ball-nuts.  There is a marginal Blue X4 placement in a shallow pod 10' up on the route, after that you can double up on 0.2 cams in the overlap that is in the middle of the slab.  This section is not hard but could be the mental crux due to blind/marginal placements.
content.location: Located 20' left of Fat City on a 15' wide buttress.  20' R of trick or Treat dihedral corner crack.

content.description: Good movement, but short and dirty.  (Placeholder name)
content.location: Right facing corner to the left of Fat City and Asian School Girls.

content.description: Cruise up to the small roof with the beautiful, but too short (5'), crack with the large evergreen tree growing from it near the top. Pull the roof on a couple fun jams then face the move that gives this route it's name.
content.protection: Small gear, nothing more than an inch or so. No anchors.
content.location: To the right of the arete that is 15 yards upstream of Rigor Mortise. Either start from up on the ledge or begin down at the trail to add 15' of fun to this one. Head up to the obvious big evergreen growing from the crack near the top.

content.description: Follow crack to bulge and trend left to the shallow corner under the small roof. Pull the roof and crank up the splitter crack to the top.
content.location: 10' left of rigor mortise. The crack behind the tree on the rock ledge.

content.description: Handcrack to ledge and bulge, continue up pillar on easier face climbing to top.
content.location: Start 30' left of Thru-Mortise at short handcrack below pillar.

content.description: Start up short left facing corner and crack to hour-glass crack, pull through then step left under roof and climb up through notch split by fingercrack.
content.location: at top of left sector approach trail turn left. Begins 10' to right of the tree on the rock ledge. Below the obvious hourglass shaped crack 20' up.

content.description: bouldery route just to the right of The Bully.  Climb steep orange face up and right to thin right facing dihedral.  Climb straight up this to small bulge.  pull this to the top.
content.protection: Thin to Win.  Very specific gear; this route was led in Hed-point style.
content.location: on shorter wall just left & uphill of Tastes Like Chicken

content.description: Start below and left of the large prow/roof work up and right to a techy mantle under the roof.  Mantle again to the ledge just left of the prow.  Go ahead and eat your lunch then climb the off-fingers sized layback crack above the ledge trending R of a very small cherry tree wedged in the top of the crack.  Commit to the slopey but easy mantle.  Direct start is about 5.10+ with a V2 boulder problem to gain the first small ledge.
content.protection: Small (not tiny) stuff.  Cams for cruxes and nuts off the ledge. Largest piece on the climb is .75 or #1.  Larger cams can be used on the anchor.  I needed doubles of .4 C4 to protect the mantle finish and the low bouldery crux below the roof.  Same gear anchor can be used on Mud Bucket & Hokie Crack with a slight shift.
content.location: Directly under the walk up for Rigor/Double Tier

content.description: A bit better and trickier than it appears.  Climb up the large steps into a alcove, make a move right around the alocve to a small knob and then stem up through the wide dihedral through double cracks using knobs and locks to a hidden left hand jug, pull up into a stance in a small chimney.
content.protection: Std rack, gear anchor in boulder above.
content.location: easiest path up the notch between the big prow on left and Cullen's Rattle/In a silent way on right

content.description: Climb white rock up to a ledge 15' up.  Climb the crux finger crack off the ledge and finish on knobby face above.
content.protection: small stuff mostly, stoppers & TCUs, key crux gear is a 0.2ish cam.  Tight fingers, and can be placed from the ledge.
content.location: on shorter wall downstream from Tastes Like Chicken, left of Alaskan Vac about 25'

content.description: Climb the nice R facing corner through a low roof move and a crux offwidth/stemming section at the top to gain a small chimney.  Topout on jugs to the left.  Mind the two chocked stones that seem like they could come off but apparently want to stay for now.  Small one on the left makes a great knocking sound!
content.protection: Std rack, finger to fist cams and one medium nut, gear anchor in boulder above topout.  Gear wise this is an extremely safe lead.
content.location: Right side of Huge prow that sits just below the main Rigor/simpsons walk-up.

content.description: This is the large chimney that the approach trail comes out in front of at the Simpsons/Bovine wall. Go up chunky corner and work up the short slab into the chimney. Work up the chimney and out to a block then around and to the top.
content.protection: Bolts in place with rap rings for top rope, accessible from above

content.description: Start under In a Silent Way, Climb a slanting feature up and to the left to reach a blunt arete (takes a 0.2 small cam), work you way through dusty fairly blank face (crux, gear ends up below your feet) into a high left facing corner, move right onto the knobby face with some rock tripe on it still, finishing just right of a good sized cherry tree that is perched at the edge of the cliff.
content.protection: Gear anchor in boulder/tree.  Need a small cam at the crux.  I also placed a tricky tri-cam for the the balancey mantle before moving up into the crux.   Crux is pretty heady at the grade and may be dusty from water runoff.
content.location: Climb the blunt arete right of Mud Bucket, left of In a Silent Way

content.description: Begins up a pair of short cracks to a ledge. Continue up a crack system to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack. Sling trees. No anchors.
content.location: At the top of the Left sector approach trail. Roughly 20' right of the Fat City chimney.

climbs.name: The Bully
climbs.fa: Bill Saul, Ian Herring, Paul Sullivan

content.description: Climbs bulging orange face up finger cracks.
content.protection: mostly 1" and smaller sized cams, stoppers
content.location: On shorter wall just downstream from Tastes Like Chicken, & just left of Alaskan Vacation.  Starts on bouldering face moves and heads up and left.

content.description: obvious crack that starts out wide and tapers to fingers
content.protection: large cam at bottom, stnd bozoo rack
content.location: on shorter wall downstream from Tastes Like Chicken
